availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Perry County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Allie Justice Holliday. Father of Raney Holliday, Green Holliday, Sarah Holliday, John Holliday, and Walter W. Holliday. Farmer in Perry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Perry County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Perry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, District 2, p. 418B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, District 1, p. 751.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, Lost Creek Precinct, p. 575A.
"W. W. Holliday," Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 13248.
KYR-0001-025-0017.
